alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 11:19AM CDT until March 27 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Initial forecast from snow melt coming out of the headwaters of the Red River, and including forecasted precipitation for the next 48 hours. Eventual crest for Fargo is still beyond the 7 day forecast. Snow melt from the southern Red River Valley still has to make its way into the river system. For the Red River...including Wahpeton, Hickson, Fargo, Halstad, East Grand Forks, Oslo, Drayton, Pembina...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Wild Rice River (ND)...including Abercrombie...Moderate flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Wahpeton. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Storm sewer valves are closed and interior pumping begins (Breckenridge). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 12.0 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
